intro: Urceolina amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian urn plant, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive urn-shaped flower buds. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers that open sequentially, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. Urceolina amazonica thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the nutrient-rich soils of the Amazon basin.
